19.16: then he handed him over to them to be crucified.  I therefore received Jesus;
19.17: and bearing the cross for himself, he went out to the so-called Place of the Skull, which is called the Hebrew Golgotha,
19.18: where they crucified him, and with him two others here and there, and Jesus in the middle.
19.19: Pilate also wrote a title and placed it on the cross, and it was written, Jesus of Nazareth, the king of the Jews.
19.20: This title, therefore, was misread by many of the Jews, because the place of the city where Jesus was crucified was nearby, and it was written Hebrew, Roman, Hellenistic.
19.21: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, Do not write, The King of the Jews, but because he said, I am the King of the Jews.
19.23: The soldiers then, when they crucified Jesus, took his clothes and made four parts, each soldier's part, and the tunic.  But the robe was woven from above, woven throughout.
19.24: Then they said to each other, Let us not tear him apart, but let us cry about him whose it is, so that the scripture may be fulfilled [which said], Divide my clothes among yourselves and cast lots on my clothing.  Those who are in the army did this.
19.25: And standing by the cross of Jesus were his mother and his mother's sister, Mary of Clopas and Mary Magdalene.
19.26: Jesus then seeing the mother and the disciple present whom he loved, says to the mother, Woman, behold your son.
19.27: He said to the disciple, Behold your mother.  And from that time the student accepted her in the same way.
19.28: After this, when Jesus saw that everything was already being done, so that the writing would be finished, he said, I thirst.
19.29: a vessel was lying in the middle of the ox; a sponge was then in the middle of the ox, and having said this, they brought it to his mouth.
19.30: When he then received the arrow, Jesus said, It is done, and he bowed his head and gave up the spirit.
19.31: The Jews then, in preparation, so that the bodies would not remain on the cross on the Sabbath, because it was a long day of that Sabbath, asked Pilate to take down their legs and fix them.
19.32: Then the soldiers came, and they took down the legs of the first one and of the other one who was crucified.
19.33: but when they came to Jesus, as I had already seen him dead, they did not take down his branches,
19.34: But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water immediately came out.
19.35: And the one who heard testified, and his testimony is true, and he saw that he was telling the truth, so that you also may believe.
19.36: For these things were done in order that the scripture might be fulfilled, so that he would not be crushed.
19.37: And again, another scripture says, they are buried in the one they were exposed to.
19.38: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus who was hidden for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate to remove the body of Jesus, and Pilate allowed it.  So he came and his body was there.
19.39: Nicodemus also came, who had come to him the first night, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes about a hundred liters.
19.40: They then took the body of Jesus and gave it to the priests with the spices, as it is the custom of the Jews to bury.
19.41: but there was a garden in the place where he was crucified, and in the garden a new monument in which I do not know that no one had been erected;
19.42: there, then, because of the preparation of the Jews, because the monument was nearby, they killed Jesus.

20.1: And on one of the Sabbaths, Mary Magdalene comes before the darkness to the monument, and sees the stone rolled away from the monument.
20.2: he then runs and comes to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus kisses, and says to them, They took the master from the tomb, and we did not see where they took him.
20.3: So Peter and the other disciple went out, and they were going to the monument.
20.4: and the two of them ran; and the other disciple ran ahead of Peter and came first to the monument,
20.5: and you turned around, he sees texts on the screens, no words entered.
20.6: Then comes Simon Peter following him, and he enters the monument; and he considers the texts on the screen,
20.7: and the shroud that was on his head, not with the text of the screens, but without being wrapped in one place.
20.8: then the other disciple who came first to the monument also entered, and he saw and believed;
20.9: I do not believe because they read the scripture that they see him rise from the dead.
20.10: Then the disciples went to them again.
20.11: But Maria is standing outside the monument crying.  As he wept, he fell to the monument,
20.12: and he sees two angels in white sitting, one at the head and one at the bier, where the body of Jesus lay.
20.13: And they said to her, Woman, why are you crying?  He says to them that they found my master, and I did not see where they found him.
20.14: Having said this, he turned his back, and considers Jesus to be here, and does not see that it is Jesus.
20.15: Jesus says to her, Woman, why are you crying?  what are you asking for?  she said to him, Lord, if you raised him, tell me where you raised him, and I will plow him.
20.16: Jesus calls her, Mary.  I turned and she says to him Hebrew, Rabvouni {who is called Teacher}.
20.17: Jesus says to her, Touch me not, for I have ascended to the father; but go to my brothers and say to them, I ascend to my father and your father and my god and your god.
20.18: Mary Magdalene comes announcing to the disciples that I have seen the Lord, and this is what he said to her.
20.19: So, on that day, one of the Sabbaths, and the doors were closed where the disciples were because of the fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the middle and said to them, Peace be with you.
20.20: And when he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side.  The disciples rejoiced, seeing the master.
20.21: Then he [Jesus] said to them again, Peace be with you; as the Father has sent me, so I send you.
20.22: And when he had said this he breathed on them and said to them, Receive the Holy Spirit.
20.23: if you forgive their sins, they are forgiven, if you keep them, they are kept.
20.24: But Thomas, one of the twelve, the so-called Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.
20.25: Then the other disciples said to him, We are listening to the master.  And he said unto them, Unless I see in his hands the type of serpents, and put my finger into the type of serpents, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.
20.26: And on the eighth day his disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them.  Jesus comes behind closed doors, and stood in the middle and said, Peace be with you.
20.27: He said to Thomas, Put your finger here and see my hands, and put your hand into my side, and do not be unfaithful but faithful.
20.28: Thomas answered and said to him, My Lord and my God.
20.29: Jesus said to him, Why do you believe me?  blessed are those who have not seen and have believed.
20.30: Many, then, and other signs did Jesus in the presence of [his] disciples, which are not written in this book;
20.31: and these are written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

21.1: After this, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples on the sea of ​​Tiberias; and they revealed themselves like this.
21.2: I had Simon Peter and Thomas called Didymus and Nathanael from Cana of Galilee and those of Zebedee and two others of his disciples.
21.3: Simon Peter says to them, Let them fish.  They say to him, We are coming with you.  They went out and got into the ship, and that night they caught nothing.
21.4: But in the morning, when it was already done, Jesus was in the agialon; the disciples did not immediately see that it was Jesus.
21.5: says oὖν αὐτοῖς [ὁ] Jesus, Children, what do you have?  they answered him, Oὔ.
21.6: And he said to them, Put the net on the right side of the ship, and you will find it.  put it then, and it is not for nothing that you are attracted by the multitude of fishes.
21.7: says the disciple whom Jesus loved to Peter, He is the Lord.  Then Simon Peter, hearing that it was the Lord, saved him, for he was naked, and threw himself into the sea.
21.8: and the other disciples came to the boat, for they were not far from the land, but as if from two hundred fathoms, dragging the net of fishes.
21.9: when they went down to earth, they saw coals of fire and fire and bread.
21.10: Jesus says to them, Bring some of the fish you have just caught.
21.11: Then Simon Peter went up and drew the net to the land in the place of a hundred and fifty-three large fishes; and of all these creatures the net did not break.
21.12: Jesus says to them, Behold, you have excelled.  But you don't have the courage of the disciples to examine him, What are you?  know that the Lord is.
21.13: Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, and the fish likewise.
21.14: This was already the third time that Jesus appeared to the disciples raised from the dead.
21.15: When they had finished, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon John, do you love me more than these?  she says to him, Yes, sir, you saw that I kiss you.  he says to him, Feed my lambs.
21.16: he says to him again the second time, Simon John, do you love me?  she says to him, Yes, sir, you saw that I kiss you.  he says to him, Feed my sheep.
21.17: the third said to him, Simon John, do you kiss me?  Peter was sorry because he said to him the third, Kiss me?  And he says to him, Lord, you have always seen, you know that I kiss you.  He [Jesus] says, Feed my sheep.
21.18: Amen, amen, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked wherever you wanted; but when you are old, you stretch out your hands, and someone else girds you, even where you do not want.
21.19: and this he said, it matters by whose death he glorifies God.  And when he had said this he said to him, Follow me.
21.20: Returning, Peter sees the disciple whom Jesus loved following him, who fell on his chest at the supper and said, Lord, what is it that gives you away?
21.21: When Peter saw this, he said to Jesus, Lord, what is this?
21.22: Jesus says to him, If I want him, he stays until I come, what do you say?  you follow me
21.23: So this word went out to the brothers that that disciple does not die.  But Jesus did not say to him that he will not die, but, If I want him, he will stay until I come [what do you say to you?]
21.24: This is the disciple who testifies about these things and who wrote these things, and we have seen that his testimony is true.
21.25: There are also many other things that Jesus did, which if written down one by one, I do not call this the world to contain the written books.
